com.underground.protofy.Views

Class mTextView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.widget.TextView
        • com.underground.protofy.Views.mTextView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewTreeObserver.OnPreDrawListener

    public class mTextView
extends android.widget.TextView
    Custom TextView class to build upon Android's existing TextView class.

      • addViewLayoutParam

        public void addViewLayoutParam(int param,
                               java.lang.String linkedViewStringId,
                               int linkViewId,
                               UIelementList listOfViews)
        Check for conflicts and add a new layout parameter if no conflict arises. Will call redrawView().
        Parameters:
        param - - Layout parameter to add
        linkedViewStringId - - String ID of view being linked to this view. (null for parent)
        linkViewId - - ID of view being linked to this view with layout param (IMPORTANT: -1 for parent view)
        listOfViews - - All views currently present in the Activity.

      • getStringLayoutParams

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getStringLayoutParams()
        Retrieve array of all layout parameters assigned to this view in a readable format
        Returns:
        - List of all layout parameters in human readable strings

      • checkParentLayoutParams

        public boolean checkParentLayoutParams(int param,
                                       int linkedViewId,
                                       UIelementList viewsOnLayout)
        Checks for any layout parameter conflicts that would occur if a specific relation to parent layout parameter was applied. IE: If a view has align parent top as a layout param, adding a align parent bottom would create a conflict and error. Will remove conflicting parameter from view. Will also check child view associations for conflicts depending on layout parameter
        Parameters:
        param - - Param to check if a conflict exists
        linkedViewId - - ID of view
        viewsOnLayout - - All views currently present in the Activity.
        Returns:
        - returns false if conflict exists

      • checkLinkedViewParams

        public boolean checkLinkedViewParams(int conflictParam,
                                     java.lang.String checkType,
                                     UIelementList viewsOnLayout)
        Check for any layout conflicts that may arise from setting a layout parameter that links two child views together.
        Parameters:
        conflictParam - - Layout parameter to check.
        checkType - - Type of check to perform. "View" denotes checking for other child view conflicts that may arise (Views overlapping etc.) "Parent" checks if linking the two views would cause a conflict with the parent viewgroup. (Placing view below a view who has ALIGN PARENT BOTTOM, making the view unselectable)
        viewsOnLayout - - All views currently present in the Activity.
        Returns:
        - returns true if no conflict is found.

      • removeViewLayoutParam

        public void removeViewLayoutParam(int param,
                                  int linkedViewId)
        Checks for and removes layout parameter from view.
        Parameters:
        param - - Layout parameter to remove
        linkedViewId - - ID of view you wish to disassociate view with. (-1 for parent)

      • updateLinkedViews

        public void updateLinkedViews(UIelementList viewsOntheLayout)
        Updates the layout of all linked views to this view. IE: If you update the position of a view, you should always call updateLinkedViews to redraw all linked views.
        Parameters:
        viewsOntheLayout - - All views currently on the activity layout

      • redrawView

        public void redrawView()
        Invalidate and redraw view with all applied attributes. Call this to force a redraw of view. This is helpful when you change a view property that will not automatically trigger android to invalidate the view.

      • initCopyView

        public void initCopyView(mTextView view,
                         java.lang.String option)
        Allows for quick creation of a view by copying over existing attributes of an already existing view.
        Parameters:
        view - - view you want to copy
        option - - type of copy you want to occur. IE: "set Text" will copy over only attributes pertaining to text displaying. Input nothing to copy over everything.

        Parameters:
        value - - true - preview mode, false - no preview
